{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3501219,"name":"Ethan Smith","username":"Ethan2","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/858c86/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-03T23:47:41.266Z","cooked":"

When we try to get our robot to follow a path, the turning motors spin uncontrollably, even if the code should only drive forward. Before, it would move forward except for one motor. After we updated the firmware, all four motors started turning uncontrollably.

We have tried:
Updating all the firmware in PhoenixTuner
Fixed all of the motor IDs
Deployed New Code

Please post a GitHub link when asking for programming help.
Also if you could tell us your robot specifications: drivetrain, motors, etc.

Are you using a well known swerve library like YAGSL with PathPlanner or something custom? Also, does the robot drive normally in teleop?

I had a similar issue (where the entire robot began to rotate uncontrollably in auto) a few days ago which I fixed by inverting the omegaRadiansPerSecond value in PathPlanner’s output ChassisSpeeds object.

github.com

GitHub - frc4087/SwerveDriveBase2025 at auto-testing

auto-testing

Code we generated from the phoenix tuner. Contribute to frc4087/SwerveDriveBase2025 development by creating an account on GitHub.

We use a Ctre Drivetrain with a Pigeon 2 and TalonFX motors.

Does it behave normally in teleop?

We use this drivetrain for autonomous, so we haven’t tried it with teleop, but even the motors snapping to their encoder offsets seemed to be messed up.

It is probably a problem with our motors being incorrectly inverted, but when we check with Tuner X, the motors do not move at all when they are supposed to.

It was a problem with IDs and motor inversion. Regenerating our Tuner Constants file fixed the issue.
